messages.subject: A Knight's Tale (movie)
messages.msgSnippet: I loved this movie!  I didn t catch, until about 20-30 mins. into it, that it was A Knight s Tale !!  DUH!  Even when they picked up Chaucer.  It wasn t until
messages.messageBody:
I loved this movie! I didn't catch, until about 20-30 mins. into it,
that it was "A Knight's Tale"!! DUH! Even when they picked up
Chaucer. It wasn't until they met the summoner and the pardoner that
i smacked my head and said to DH, "OOHH!! A KNIGHT's Tale.... as in
Canterbury!!" ROFL. I just thought it was a story about a knight,
like Dragonheart of one of those...

I can be so SLOW... ;o)

I know that's off topic... so i'll just add that i really enjoy your
conversations regarding unschooling. Even if i don't decide to do
that with my son, it will greatly affect how i homeschool and even
parent him. I used to be MUCH more rigid and had high expectations
of what he should do/see/say and how he should act, etc... I'm
really learning to back off. so, THANK YOU!!

Mostly lurking,
TATE (41 wks pg)
=o)
